newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Thieves making off with S. African parliament.
newsitem.headline: Thieves making off with S. African parliament.

text.p: Thieves are stealing South Africa's parliament.
Rampant theft has plagued the red-brick Cape Town legislature since the iron grip of white rule ended in 1994.
A police report released on Friday lists copper cladding worth 6,500 rand ($1,445) stolen from the roof of parliament among the 83 thefts reported this year.
Another entry shows "10 lengths of cream-coloured curtains" of unknown value stolen in the first week of August.

The police report, which includes an appeal for help, lists thefts with a reported value of 62,000 rand, including nine computers, five cellular telephones, two microwave ovens, calculators, kettles, sports gear and cash.
The list includes several thefts from cars parked in an underground garage, including one case in which new windscreen wiper blades were replaced with old ones.
